lines.text: Tony, your system works. You just haven't found anybody yet it works on.
That wasn't my husband, that was a friend. He is still a live. My husband died eighteen months ago.
Oh, thank god. I mean, that your friend's still alive and your husband is dead.
It wouldn't be a date, just a meal. As a matter of fact, we could sit at different tables.
What about your girlfriend? Doesn't she like sailing?
You know, I always thought it was the bottle of champagne that makes the boat move forweard.

[to Diane who is holding Tony's hand]
Please let go of his hand. I said let go of his hand. Thank you. A woman must fight for her man, mustn't she? After all, I'm sagittarian and it's time for my afternoon delight. Call me?
I was going to ask you if you like this man Tony?
I have to write this down. Otherwise I simply forget it.

[makes a dismissive gesture]
That's all right.
No, no. That's because otherwise I forget to pick up the dry cleaning.
